title: Claude Code Instructions

text: PRs merged CI passes. Run checks locally opening PR:

previous_headings: Local Testing Before PRs (REQUIRED)
title: Claude Code Instructions
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./pynmschooldata && pytest tests/test_pynmschooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

previous_headings: Local Testing Before PRs (REQUIRED)
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_pynmschooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: nmschooldata package fetches enrollment data New Mexico Public Education Department (NM PED). data comes two main sources different structures: 40-Day Enrollment Reports: Collected second Wednesday October (approximately 40 school days year) 80-Day Enrollment Reports: Collected December 1st (approximately 80 school days year)

previous_headings: Data Availability by Year
title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: older files contain enrollment grade (demographic subgroups): District-level school-level data Individual grade breakdowns (PK 12) Total enrollment demographic subgroups (race, gender, special populations)
code: # Era 1 data structure enr_2017 <- fetch_enr(2017)  # Only 'total' subgroup available unique(enr_2017$subgroup) #> [1] "total"  # But all grade levels are present unique(enr_2017$grade_level) #> [1] "TOTAL" "PK" "K" "01" "02" "03" "04" "05" "06" "07" "08" "09" "10" "11" "12"

previous_headings: Data Availability by Year
title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: files contain demographic subgroups school level: School-level data (district aggregates raw files) 13 demographic subgroups TOTAL enrollment (individual grade breakdowns) State totals calculated package school-level data
code: # Era 2a data structure enr_2023 <- fetch_enr(2023)  # All 13 subgroups available unique(enr_2023$subgroup) #>  [1] "total" "white" "black" "hispanic" "asian" "native_american" #>  [7] "pacific_islander" "multiracial" "male" "female" "special_ed" #> [13] "ell" "econ_disadv"  # Only TOTAL grade level unique(enr_2023$grade_level) #> [1] "TOTAL"

previous_headings: Data Availability by Year
title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: Important: 40-Day subgroup file 2023-24 published NM PED. 80-Day data available: District-level data (school breakdowns) Individual grade breakdowns (PK 12) demographic subgroups package displays warning fetching 2024 data
code: # 2024 data structure (shows a warning message) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024) #> Note: 2024 (SY 2023-24) only has 80-Day enrollment data available. #>       40-Day subgroup data has not been published by NM PED.  # Only 'total' subgroup available unique(enr_2024$subgroup) #> [1] "total"  # But all grade levels are present unique(enr_2024$grade_level) #> [1] "TOTAL" "PK" "K" "01" "02" "03" "04" "05" "06" "07" "08" "09" "10" "11" "12"

previous_headings: Data Availability by Year
title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: recent data similar 2019-2023 new file format: Three sheets: State, District, School level data 13 demographic subgroups TOTAL enrollment (individual grade breakdowns)
code: # 2025 data structure enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # All three levels available table(enr_2025$type[enr_2025$subgroup == "total" & enr_2025$grade_level == "TOTAL"]) #> District   School    State #>      155      876        1  # All 13 subgroups available length(unique(enr_2025$subgroup)) #> [1] 13

title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: demographic data available, following 13 subgroups included: Race/Ethnicity: - white - Caucasian/White students - black - Black African American students - hispanic - Hispanic/Latino students - asian - Asian students - native_american - American Indian/Alaska Native students - pacific_islander - Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander students - multiracial - Two races Gender: - male - female Special Populations: - special_ed - Students disabilities (IEP) - ell - English Language Learners - econ_disadv - Economically Disadvantaged (Free/Reduced Lunch eligible)

previous_headings: Tips for Working with the Data
title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
code: # For consistent state totals, use years with 40-Day data enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2019:2023, 2025))  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students)  state_totals

previous_headings: Tips for Working with the Data
title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
code: # Demographics only available for 2019-2023, 2025 enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2019:2023, 2025))  hispanic_trend <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "hispanic", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students, pct)  hispanic_trend

previous_headings: Tips for Working with the Data
title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
code: # Grade breakdowns only for Era 1 (2016-2018) and 2024 enr_2017 <- fetch_enr(2017)  kindergarten_by_district <- enr_2017 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "K") |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  kindergarten_by_district

title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: Understanding data availability crucial : Trend Analysis: compare years similar data structures Demographic Analysis: Must use 2019-2023 2025 race/ethnicity data Grade Analysis: Must use 2016-2018 2024 individual grade data Research Planning: Know questions can answered available data

title: Understanding NM PED Data Availability
text: data comes New Mexico Public Education Department (NM PED): STARS System Overview NM Vistas

what: 1. New Mexico’s enrollment has been declining
title: 10 Insights from New Mexico School Enrollment Data
text: Like many western states, New Mexico’s K-12 enrollment steadily declining past several years, COVID accelerating trend.
code: # Note: 2024 excluded as only 80-Day data is available (no 40-Day subgroup file) enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2019:2023, 2025))  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2))  state_totals #>   end_year n_students change pct_change #> 1     2025     306578     NA         NA ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#C41230") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#C41230") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "New Mexico Public School Enrollment (2019-2023, 2025)",     subtitle = "Steady decline accelerated by COVID-19",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

what: 2. Albuquerque dominates but is shrinking fastest
title: 10 Insights from New Mexico School Enrollment Data
text: Albuquerque Public Schools serves roughly one-quarter New Mexico students, district losing enrollment faster state average.
code: top_districts <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL",          end_year == 2025) |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  top_districts #> [1] district_name n_students    #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names) top_districts |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name, fill = district_name)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.2))) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "turbo") +   labs(     title = "New Mexico's Largest School Districts (2025)",     subtitle = "APS serves about 1 in 4 NM students",     x = "Total Enrollment",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from New Mexico School Enrollment Data
text: New Mexico one diverse states nation. Hispanic students make 60% enrollment, significant Native American representation.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  demographics <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("hispanic", "white", "native_american", "black", "asian", "multiracial")) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  demographics #>          subgroup n_students  pct #> 1        hispanic     194481 63.4 #> 2           white      60984 19.9 #> 3 native_american      29763  9.7 #> 4     multiracial       6391  2.1 #> 5           black       4447  1.5 #> 6           asian       2966  1.0 demographics |>   mutate(subgroup = forcats::fct_reorder(subgroup, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = subgroup, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(pct, "%")), hjust = -0.1) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   labs(     title = "New Mexico Student Demographics (2025)",     subtitle = "Hispanic students are the clear majority",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from New Mexico School Enrollment Data
text: New Mexico third-highest Native American student population country, concentrated districts near Navajo Nation, Zuni, numerous Pueblos.
code: native_am <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "native_american", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students, pct) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1))  native_am #> [1] district_name n_students    pct           #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)

title: 10 Insights from New Mexico School Enrollment Data
text: New Mexico school enrollment dropped significantly COVID hasn’t fully recovered, signaling demographic challenges years come.
code: # Note: Individual grade breakdowns not available in 40-Day subgroup files (2019-2023, 2025) # Using Era 1 (2016-2018) and 2024 (80-Day) for grade-level analysis enr_grades <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2016:2018, 2024))  state_totals_by_era <- enr_grades |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students)  state_totals_by_era #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2016     339613 #> 2     2017     338307 #> 3     2018     337847 #> 4     2024     308913 # Show overall enrollment decline using all available years all_years <- fetch_enr_multi(2016:2025)  all_years |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#C41230") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#C41230") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, limits = c(300000, 350000)) +   labs(     title = "New Mexico Public School Enrollment (2016-2025)",     subtitle = "Steady decline accelerated by COVID-19",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

what: 6. Albuquerque vs Las Cruces: Two cities diverging
title: 10 Insights from New Mexico School Enrollment Data
text: Albuquerque Las Cruces New Mexico’s two largest districts, enrollment trajectories differed.
code: abq_lc <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Albuquerque|Las Cruces", district_name)) |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students)  abq_lc #> # A tibble: 0 × 1 #> # ℹ 1 variable: district_name <chr> enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Albuquerque|Las Cruces", district_name)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Albuquerque vs Las Cruces Enrollment",     subtitle = "The state's two largest districts",     x = "School Year",     y = "Enrollment",     color = "District"   )

title: 10 Insights from New Mexico School Enrollment Data
text: New Mexico’s school enrollment data reveals: Declining enrollment: state lost students steadily since 2019 Hispanic majority: 60% students Hispanic Native American presence: Third-highest tribal enrollment nation Urban concentration: APS serves 1 4 students statewide COVID impact: Kindergarten hit hardest, rippling cohorts patterns shape school funding debates facility planning across Land Enchantment. Data sourced New Mexico Public Education Department STARS System.

title: New Mexico School Data
text: Fetch analyze New Mexico school enrollment data New Mexico Public Education Department (PED) R Python.

what: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: 10 years enrollment data (2016-2025). Around 330,000 students. 89 school districts. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: New Mexico one diverse states nation. Hispanic students make 60% enrollment, significant Native American representation.
code: library(nmschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr(2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup != "total") %>%   filter(subgroup %in% c("hispanic", "white", "native_american", "black", "asian")) %>%   mutate(pct = pct * 100) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: New Mexico third-highest Native American student population country, concentrated districts near Navajo Nation, Zuni, numerous Pueblos.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "native_american") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: Like many western states, New Mexico’s K-12 enrollment peaked slowly declining.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
what: 4. COVID hit New Mexico schools hard
title: New Mexico School Data
text: pandemic caused notable enrollment drops, especially early elementary grades families delayed kindergarten entry.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "06", "09")) %>%   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: Albuquerque Public Schools serves roughly one-quarter New Mexico students, district losing enrollment faster state average.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total",          grepl("Albuquerque", district_name)) %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) %>%   mutate(     change_pct = (n_students / first(n_students) - 1) * 100   )

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: New Mexico’s schools range large urban districts like Albuquerque Las Cruces tiny rural districts serving fewer 100 students.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2023)  # District size distribution enr %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total") %>%   mutate(size_category = case_when(     n_students >= 10000 ~ "Large (10k+)",     n_students >= 1000 ~ "Medium (1k-10k)",     n_students >= 100 ~ "Small (100-1k)",     TRUE ~ "Tiny (<100)"   )) %>%   group_by(size_category) %>%   summarize(     n_districts = n(),     total_students = sum(n_students)   )

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: New Mexico one highest child poverty rates country. economically disadvantaged student data tells story.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "econ_disadv") %>%   select(n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
what: 8. English Learners in a bilingual state
title: New Mexico School Data
text: New Mexico’s border location cultural heritage means significant English Learner population.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2023)  # State-level EL enrollment enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "ell") %>%   select(n_students, pct)  # Districts with highest EL populations enr %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "ell") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: New Mexico follows national patterns smaller kindergarten cohorts upper grades, demographic shift work way system.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total",          grade_level %in% c("PK", "K", "01", "05", "08", "12")) %>%   select(grade_level, n_students) %>%   arrange(match(grade_level, c("PK", "K", "01", "05", "08", "12")))

previous_headings: What can you find with nmschooldata?
title: New Mexico School Data
text: New Mexico significant charter school sector. Compare district-run schools versus charter schools across state.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2023)  # Schools by type enr %>%   filter(is_school, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total") %>%   mutate(is_charter = grepl("Charter|Academy", school_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) %>%   group_by(is_charter) %>%   summarize(     n_schools = n(),     total_enrollment = sum(n_students)   )

title: New Mexico School Data
text: See full vignette insights.

previous_headings: Quick start
title: New Mexico School Data
code: library(nmschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2023 <- fetch_enr(2023)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2023)  # State totals enr_2023 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2023 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics statewide enr_2023 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("hispanic", "white", "native_american", "black", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: Quick start
title: New Mexico School Data
code: import pynmschooldata as nm  # Check available years years = nm.get_available_years() print(f"Data available: {years['min_year']}-{years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year enr_2023 = nm.fetch_enr(2023)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = nm.fetch_enr_multi([2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023])  # State totals state_total = enr_2023[     (enr_2023['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2023['subgroup'] == 'total') &     (enr_2023['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # District breakdown districts = enr_2023[     (enr_2023['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2023['subgroup'] == 'total') &     (enr_2023['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)

previous_headings: Data availability
title: New Mexico School Data
text: Demographics: 13 subgroups (race/ethnicity, gender, special populations) available 2019-2023 2025. demographics 2016-2018 2024. Grade Breakdown: Individual grade counts (PK-12) available 2016-2018 2024. TOTAL 2019-2023 2025. 40-Day vs 80-Day: New Mexico reports enrollment 40-day 80-day counts. package uses 40-day data available (standard snapshot used funding). Note: 2024 80-Day data - 40-Day subgroup file never published NM PED.

what: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: NM PED uses various URL patterns across years. function generates list URLs try based observed patterns.

title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: end_year School year end

title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: Character vector URLs try

title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: URL patterns discovered research: Era 1 (2016-2018) - Enrollment district/location/grade : 2016: /wp-content/uploads/2018/01/2015-2016-Enrollment--district--location--grade-1.xls 2017: /wp-content/uploads/2018/01/2016-2017-Enrollment--district--location--grade-1.xls 2018: /wp-content/uploads/2018/01/2017-2018-Enrollment--district--location--grade-1.xls Era 2 (2019-2025) - Subgroup enrollment demographics: 2019: /wp-content/uploads/2025/01/SY2018-2019-Subgroup-Enrollment--Grade-40D--district--school-final-1.xlsx 2020: /wp-content/uploads/2025/01/SY2019-2020-Subgroup-Enrollment--Grade-40D--district--school-final-1.xlsx 2021: /wp-content/uploads/2025/01/SY2020-2021-Subgroup-Enrollment--Grade-40D--district--school-final-1.xlsx 2022: /wp-content/uploads/2025/01/SY2021-2022-Subgroup-Enrollment--Grade-40D--district--school_Final.xlsx 2023: /wp-content/uploads/2025/01/SY-22-23-40D-Enrollment-Subgroup-Percentages--Averages-Certified.xlsx 2024: /wp-content/uploads/2025/01/SY2023_2024_80D_Enrollment_By_District_by_Grade_Certified_20240605.xlsx (80D ) 2025: /wp-content/uploads/_legacy/2025/02/SY2024_2025_40D_Enrollment_Subgroup_Percentages.xlsx

title: Fetch New Mexico enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch New Mexico enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2016-2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format downloaded. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download NM PED.

title: Fetch New Mexico enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_code, school_code, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup n_students columns.

title: Fetch New Mexico enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: 2016-2018 Enrollment grade (demographic subgroups) 2019-2023, 2025 Full demographic subgroups available 2024 80-Day enrollment data available; 40-Day subgroup file published

title: Fetch New Mexico enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district albuquerque <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(grepl("Albuquerque", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

title: Identify enrollment aggregation levels — id_enr_aggs
text: data.frame boolean aggregation flags

title: Identify enrollment aggregation levels — id_enr_aggs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tidy_data <- fetch_enr(2024) # Data already has aggregation flags via id_enr_aggs table(tidy_data$is_state, tidy_data$is_district, tidy_data$is_school) } # }

what: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data New Mexico Public Education Department (PED). Provides functions fetching enrollment data STARS (Student Teacher Accountability Reporting System) transforming tidy format analysis.

title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations

title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: New Mexico uses hierarchical ID system: District codes: 3 digits (e.g., 001 = Albuquerque Public Schools) School codes: 3 digits within district Full IDs combine district school codes

title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: Data sourced New Mexico Public Education Department: PED Main: https://webnew.ped.state.nm.us/ STARS: https://web.ped.nm.gov/bureaus/information-technology/stars/ NM Vistas: https://nmvistas.org/

title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: Enrollment data available 2016-2025: 2016-2018: Enrollment grade (demographic subgroups) 2019-2023, 2025: Full 40-Day (40D) subgroup enrollment demographics 2024: 80-Day data available (40D subgroup file yet published) Data includes state, district, school level enrollment counts.

title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: New Mexico approximately 89 school districts. state majority-minority student population Hispanic students representing largest demographic group. state also significant Native American student enrollment, particularly districts near tribal lands.

title: nmschooldata: Fetch and Process New Mexico School Data — nmschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com

title: Parse Era 2 Excel file (2019-present) — parse_era2_excel
text: Newer NM PED enrollment files include demographic subgroup breakdowns race/ethnicity special populations. Different year files different structures: 2019-2023: 10 header rows skip, single sheet named "Masked" 2024: 80-Day file header rows, district-level , grade columns 2025: header rows, three sheets (School, District, State)
